result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick L Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
AODA and treatment as recommended including residential treatment.
AODA and treatment as recommended including residential treatment.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation and treatment as recommended.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Shall not reside anywhere there is alcohol, drug paraphernalia or controlled substances. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol or controlled substances.

Complete individual therapy. Complete criminal thinking class. Write letter of apology to victim. Provide letter to agent to provide to victim by 6/1/16.  Random UA testing at least every 2 wks for 1st 6 mo & at least monthly there after. Must be observed UAs.

timeConds.notes:
With huber. Stayed for successful compliance with AODA treatment.
12/19/16 Crt extends stay of conditional jail for another 6 mo (6/19/17).

100 hrs to be completed in 2016.
12/19/16 Crt orders community service due in 6 mo (6/19/17).

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. May not live anywhere there is alcohol or illegal drugs.
Home, car and property shall be randomly searched.  Random UA & BA testing at min of every 2 wks.

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT IS TERMINATED FROM BMP
$7,500 per case 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with N.J.A.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.  
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall take any prescribed medications as prescribed.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian,unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.

It is hereby ordered that the Def is terminated from BMP and cash bail is reinstated in the amount of $7,500 per case with BMP removed as a condition of bond. All other bail conditions remain set.
